title: StatSocial Platform
description:
API Reference:

The StatSocial API is organized around REST. Our API is designed to have predictable, resource-oriented URLs and to use HTTP response codes to indicate API errors. We use built-in HTTP features, like HTTP authentication and HTTP verbs, which can be understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients, and we support cross-origin resource sharing to allow you to interact securely with our API from a client-side web application (remember that you should never expose your secret API key in any public website's client-side code). JSON will be returned in all responses from the API, including errors (though if you're using API bindings, we will convert the response to the appropriate language-specific object).

Contact help@statsocial.com to obtain a test API key

actions.title: applications.status.get
actions.description: Remaining window and remaining count details, also returns reports that have been generated by this account.

actions.title: reports.get
actions.description: Output is ordered by Demographic and followed by Affinity information. For each data point the following metrics are provided value, count, mean, percentile, multiplicity and average. For Geographic, and Demographic data points an additional statistical_info metric will be present with information regarding statistical relevance.

report_date.description: report_date represents a Unix timestamp of when the report was generated. Default value will be the latest report generated. You can request the /report/dates/ endpoint in order to obtain available timestamps. Date must be in the future.

actions.title: reports.post
actions.description: Output is ordered by Demographic and followed by Affinity information. For each data point the following metrics are provided value, count, mean, percentile, multiplicity and average. For Geographic, and Demographic data points an additional statistical_info metric will be present with information regarding statistical relevance.

report_date.description: report_date represents a Unix timestamp of when the report was generated. Default value will be the latest report generated. You can request the /report/dates/ endpoint in order to obtain available timestamps. Date must be in the future.

actions.title: reports.custom.create.get
actions.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

upload_hash.description: Upload hash to be used for inserting handles

filter.description: Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form, example: {'gender':['male'],'ages':['18-24'],'countries':['usa']}

actions.title: reports.custom.create.post
actions.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

upload_hash.description: Upload hash to be used for inserting handles

filter.description: Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form, example: {'gender':['male'],'ages':['18-24'],'countries':['usa']}

actions.title: reports.custom.generate.get
actions.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

actions.title: reports.custom.generate.post
actions.description: Used to create a custom report. This report treats the list of ids or handles as the audience (not their followers as in the twitter report). To create follower or tweet reports other methods must be used.

actions.title: reports.custom.insert.get
actions.description: Inserting twitter ids or handles into a custom report. This is used for custom reports only

upload_hash.description: Upload hash to be used for inserting handles

ids.description: List of twitter ids, separated by commas, to be inserted into report. Ids must be enclosed with brackets ie. [177490485] or [177490485,23423434]

actions.title: reports.custom.insert.post
actions.description: Inserting twitter ids or handles into a custom report. This is used for custom reports only

upload_hash.description: Upload hash to be used for inserting handles

ids.description: List of twitter ids, separated by commas, to be inserted into report. Ids must be enclosed with brackets ie. [177490485] or [177490485,23423434]

actions.title: reports.dates.get
actions.description: Get report dates available for a specific report.

actions.title: reports.dates.post
actions.description: Get report dates available for a specific report.

actions.title: reports.status.get
actions.description: Returns a list of custom reports generated by user (report name to upload hash etc).

actions.title: reports.status.post
actions.description: Returns a list of custom reports generated by user (report name to upload hash etc).

actions.title: reports.tweet.create.get
actions.description: This report details the audience of the users who have tweeted content that matches what was provided in the keywords. To create custom or twitter reports other methods must be used.

start_date.description: A unix timestamp. start_date will be set to the previous midnight.

end_date.description: A unix timestamp. end_date will be set to the next midnight.

terms.description: If you are tracking a single term, then the keyword itself is suffice otherwise, tracking multiple terms must be in JSON form, example '[{"operator":"","word":"http://google.com"},{"operator":"or","word":"#test"},{"operator":"and","word":"test2"}]' Which results in filtering tweets containing 'http://google.com' OR '#test' AND 'test2'. (NOTE) Make sure to URL encode the terms value for multiple terms.

filter.description: Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form, example: {'gender':['male'],'ages':['18-24'],'countries':['usa']}

actions.title: reports.tweet.create.post
actions.description: This report details the audience of the users who have tweeted content that matches what was provided in the keywords. To create custom or twitter reports other methods must be used.

start_date.description: A unix timestamp. start_date will be set to the previous midnight.

end_date.description: A unix timestamp. end_date will be set to the next midnight.

terms.description: If you are tracking a single term, then the keyword itself is suffice otherwise, tracking multiple terms must be in JSON form, example '[{"operator":"","word":"http://google.com"},{"operator":"or","word":"#test"},{"operator":"and","word":"test2"}]' Which results in filtering tweets containing 'http://google.com' OR '#test' AND 'test2'. (NOTE) Make sure to URL encode the terms value for multiple terms.

filter.description: Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form, example: {'gender':['male'],'ages':['18-24'],'countries':['usa']}

actions.title: reports.twitter.create.get
actions.description: This report uses the twitter followers as the audience. To create custom or tweet reports other methods must be used. Any report older than two days will be automatically regenerated upon create.

twitter_id.description: (required if twitter_handle is not supplied) twitter_id must be sent with all client requests. Multiple handles are separated by commas.

twitter_handle.description: (required if twitter_id is not supplied) twitter_handle must be sent with all client requests. Multiple ids are separated by commas.

filter.description: Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form, example: {'gender':['male'],'ages':['18-24'],'countries':['usa']}

actions.description: This report uses the twitter followers as the audience. To create custom or tweet reports other methods must be used. Any report older than two days will be automatically regenerated upon create.

twitter_id.description: (required if twitter_handle is not supplied) twitter_id must be sent with all client requests. Multiple handles are separated by commas.

twitter_handle.description: (required if twitter_id is not supplied) twitter_handle must be sent with all client requests. Multiple ids are separated by commas.

filter.description: Filtering options to be used when creating a filtered report. The options must be in JSON form, example: {'gender':['male'],'ages':['18-24'],'countries':['usa']}
